item.description:
Newburyport is 40 miles north of Boston. 3 films that sound interesting, all playing on Sunday, Oct. 1. The first film is at The Firehouse Center and two blocks away at The Screening Room the other two will screen. Local map is on the festival site below. Tickets are $6 per film.

After "Black Gold" we'll go to The Grog, a local pub/restaurant:

http://www.thegrog.co...

Directions from Boston to The Firehouse:
http://maps.google.co...

At 11 a.m. "Asparagus! (A Stalkumentary) depicts Wisconisn farmers who during lean times chose asparagus as their cash crop. Then, during the 1990's the US War on Drugs aided countries to replace their coca farming with asparagus. here's a link:

http://www.fullframef...

At 12:45 "Class Act" looks at the disappearing arts programs in US schools. Here's a look:

http://www.variety.co...

And at 3 pm "Black Gold". This is a well-received British documentary concerning the coffee-industry and our obsession with this drink.
http://www.variety.co...

.

Here is the website for the festival:

http://www.newburypor...
item.name: Newburyport Documentary Film Festival
